Class OaFBufferConstructorTest

java.lang.Object
com.beemediate.beemediate.domain.service.oafbuffer.OaFBufferConstructorTest
public class OaFBufferConstructorTest extends Object
Test class for OaFBuffer constructor using Partition Testing with parameterized test cases. This class implements partition testing methodology by dividing the input domain (capacity values) into distinct equivalence classes:
  • Negative values partition: capacity = -1 (invalid)
  • Boundary value partition: capacity = 0 (boundary condition)
  • Valid values partition: capacity = 5 (valid positive value)
The parameterized test approach allows testing multiple scenarios with different input values while keeping the test logic centralized. Each parameter set is executed as a separate test case.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • OaFBufferConstructorTest

      public OaFBufferConstructorTest(int capacity)
      Constructor for parameterized test initialization. This constructor is called by the Parameterized test runner for each parameter set, allowing the capacity parameter to be injected and tested.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity value from the current partition being tested

  • Method Details

    • parameters

      public static Collection<Object[]> parameters()
      Provides test parameters for partition testing. Returns three equivalence partitions:
      • Negative partition: -1 (expects exception)
      • Boundary partition: 0 (expects exception)
      • Valid partition: 5 (expects successful creation)
      Returns:
      Collection of Object arrays containing test parameter values

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Setup method executed before each parameterized test execution. Initializes mock objects for OrderProviderPort and OaFValidatorIF to be used during constructor testing.

    • test

      public void test()
      Parameterized test method for OaFBuffer constructor validation. Tests the constructor behavior across different input partitions:
      • Valid partition (capacity > 0): asserts successful object creation
      • Invalid partitions (capacity â‰¤ 0): asserts that an Exception is thrown
      This test demonstrates partition testing by verifying that each equivalence class behaves according to specification.
